sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• Prucalopride succinate has centralized marketing authorization by the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for use in the European Union (EU)
  • Safety and efficacy in men not established; use not recommended
  • Constipation, chronic, In women in whom laxatives fail to provide adequate relief: 2 mg ORALLY once daily (European Medicines Agency-approved dosing)

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono: Not for use in pediatric patients as efficacy compared with placebo was not established

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono:
• Elderly (over 65 years): Initial, 1 mg orally once daily; then 2 mg orally once daily if needed
  • Renal impairment, mild to moderate: No dosage adjustment necessary
  • Renal impairment, severe (GFR less than 30 mL/min/1.73 m(2)): Reduce dosage to 1 mg orally once daily
  • Renal impairment, requiring dialysis: Use contraindicated
  • Hepatic impairment, mild to moderate: No dosage adjustment necessary
  • Hepatic impairment, severe (Child-Pugh class C): Initial, 1 mg orally once daily; may increase to 2 mg orally once daily to improve efficacy if 1 mg dose is well tolerated

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
Non-FDA Labeled Indications
Constipation, chronic, In women in whom laxatives fail to provide adequate relief

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono:
• hypersensitivity to prucalopride succinate or any component of the product
  • renal impairment requiring dialysis
  • intestinal perforation or obstruction due to structural or functional disorder of gut wall, obstructive ileus, or severe inflammatory conditions of intestinal tract (eg, Crohn disease, ulcerative colitis, toxic megacolon/megarectum)

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• arrhythmias, history
  • breastfeeding; use not recommended
  • cardiovascular disease, ischemic
  • children and adolescents younger than 18 years; use not recommended
  • concomitant disease, severe and clinically unstable (eg, cardiovascular or lung disease, neurological or psychiatric disorders, cancer or AIDS, other endocrine disorders)
  • galactose intolerance (rare hereditary problems), Lapp lactase deficiency, or glucose-galactose malabsorption; use not recommended
  • hepatic impairment, severe (Child-Pugh class C); dose adjustment recommended
  • men; use not recommended
  • pregnancy; use not recommended; effective contraception should be used during therapy
  • renal impairment, severe (GFR less than 30 mL/min/1.73 m(2)); dose adjustment recommended
